title: SB 1.19.39-40 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 06-06-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: As you might be aware, Bhagavatam is divided into 12 cantos, skandha in Sanskrit.
segments.summary: HH Stoka Krishna Swami introduces the Srimad Bhagavatam, explaining its structure of 12 cantos, chapters, and verses, highlighting the significance of the 10th canto which focuses on Krishna Leela.

segments.key_quote: In the Vedic culture, even the poorest of the householders keep at least 10 cows.
segments.summary: The lecture delves into the meaning of verse 39, discussing the Vedic culture where householders maintain cows and provide milk to mendicants, emphasizing the self-sufficiency and charitable nature of this lifestyle.

themes: Importance of association with saintly persons
segments.key_quote: So, to take advantage of the saintly persons coming for begging is the real business of a householder.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that saintly persons stay only briefly, and householders should use that opportunity to gain spiritual knowledge, emphasizing the importance of association with saints.

themes: Reciprocal relationship between saints and householders
segments.key_quote: The purpose of our existence should be to get that which is not available anywhere and what is that how to extricate oneself from this material bond
segments.summary: The lecture emphasizes that householders should seek spiritual knowledge from saints, focusing on liberation from material bondage rather than material benefits, highlighting the unique value that saints can provide.

segments.key_quote: One who is a pure devotee of Krishna, he has got all the good qualities that are to be found in even the devatas. All the good qualities.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses verse 40, highlighting the qualities of King Pariksit as a devotee and his ability to ask perfect questions, setting the stage for Shukadeva Goswami's reply in the next canto.
